para.text: The Director of the Homeland Security and Emergency Management Agency ("HSEMA") shall establish and direct the administration and operations of an intelligence fusion center ("Fusion Center") for the District within HSEMA.

The mission of the Fusion Center is to receive, analyze, coordinate, and share resources, expertise, and information, including criminal history record information and law enforcement intelligence information, from and among law enforcement, first responder, and criminal justice agencies, with the goal of detecting and preventing terrorist and other criminal activity and supporting investigations of and responses to such activity.
Serve as the primary intelligence fusion center in the National Capital Region;
Partner with other local, state, regional, and federal fusion centers and local, state, regional, and federal law enforcement, criminal justice, and intelligence agencies;
Represent the District's interests in the national network of fusion centers;
Receive, analyze, coordinate, and share resources, expertise, and information with law enforcement agencies about a specific individual only if the information is:
Related to an actual or suspected criminal act or possible terrorist activity;
Part of a risk assessment; or
Related to a threat or vulnerability, suspicious activity or a suspicious incident, or critical infrastructure or a key resource;
Establish a policy for the duties required by paragraph (4) of this subsection; and
Submit an annual report to the Council committee with jurisdiction over homeland security matters regarding the Fusion Center's operations during the prior year; which shall include:
A description of the Fusion Center's structure, agency membership, staffing, and budget;

A general narrative about the types of cases, crimes, incidents, and reports the Fusion Center has reviewed and evaluated, in a manner that protects personal privacy, security interests, and the integrity of the Fusion Center's work;

Any privacy audits performed in the prior year, and de-identified information from those audits, regarding the cases, crimes, incidents, and reports on which the Fusion Center worked during the prior year that were reviewed during the audits; and
A copy of the policy required by paragraph (5) of this subsection.
The Fusion Center shall be considered a law enforcement organization for the purposes of carrying out the functions set forth in this section.
Nothing in this section shall be construed as conferring on the Fusion Center any additional law enforcement authority, including the authority to conduct searches, seizures, or arrests.
